meanings.definition: In a thin or slender manner
meanings.sent1: She walked lankily across the tightrope, trying to keep her balance.
meanings.sent2: The cat moved lankily through the narrow alley, squeezing between the bins.
meanings.sent3: The giraffe lankily reached for the leaves on the tall tree, almost tipping over.
meanings.sent4: The branches of the willow tree swayed lankily in the gentle breeze.
meanings.sent5: The spider crawled lankily along the delicate web, careful not to break it.

meanings.sent1: The lankily built man had to duck to enter the old house.
meanings.sent2: She felt self-conscious about her lankily long limbs in the dance class.
meanings.sent3: The lankily scarecrow in the field seemed to wobble in the wind.
meanings.sent4: The skyscraper stood lankily among the shorter buildings in the city skyline.
meanings.sent5: Her lankily figure made her a standout in the crowd of shorter people.
